content: sizes 0 3 6 9 12 months yarn amount 50 50 50 100 100 grams gauge 28 stitches = 10 cm on 3 mm needles pebble bonnet is an easy-to-knit project it is a free pattern from earthernal you can reach us on instagram or by email post@earthernal com by scanning the qr code you will be directed to our youtube channel here you can find videos that may help you with your knitting 1 © earthernal 2025 this pattern is for personal use only and may not be shared redistributed or copied items made from this pattern may not be produced for sale ribbing cast on 70 75 80 85 90 stitches on 2 5 mm circular needles the first row is worked from the wrong side as long as you are knitting back and forth the first and last stitch on each row should be edge stitches the first stitch is always slipped as if to purl with the yarn in front of the work the last stitch is always knitted work two centimetres of ribbing back and forth in knit one purl one the final row should be from the wrong side garter stitch section change to three millimetre needles and continue in garter stitch garter stitch is made by knitting every stitch on both the right and wrong side continue until the work measures 10 11 5 13 14 15 centimetres from the cast-on edge finish with a row from the wrong side star-shaped decrease knit one row while dividing the stitches onto double-pointed needles do not turn the work continue knitting in the round using the double-pointed needles continue in garter stitch when knitting garter stitch in the round knit one round and purl the next the first round in the round will be a purl round from here decreases are made on every knit round that is every other round as described below with one fewer knit stitch before and after each decrease every time continue until 10 15 10 15 10 stitches remain decrease 5 5 6 6 7 knit stitches knit two stitches together through the back loops 0 1 0 1 0 knit stitches knit two stitches together 5 5 6 6 7 knit stitches bind off instead of purling one round knit two stitches together across the round if you have fifteen stitches remaining also knit the last stitch together with the first stitch cut the yarn and pull it through the remaining stitches neck edge use 2 5 mm needles to pick up approximately one stitch in each edge stitch along the neck edge from the right side pick up stitches by inserting the needle into the opening making a yarn over and pulling the loop back through work 2 2 5 3 3 3 5 centimetres of ribbing back and forth in knit one purl one remember that the first and last stitch should be edge stitches the final row should be from the wrong side 2 ©
